intro: Trachyspermum anethifolium, commonly known as Persian cumin, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Middle East and parts of South Asia. It features slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinct anise-like aroma. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, followed by oval, brownish seeds that are rich in essential oils. Its botanical characteristics include a hairy surface and a preference for well-drained soils. It is widely cultivated for its aromatic seeds used in culinary and medicinal applications.
